stanza.line: 'Tis better to be vile than vile (a)esteemed(/a)
When not to be receives reproach of (b)being(/b)
And the just pleasure lost which is so (a)deemed(/a)
Not by our feeling but by others' (b)seeing(/b)
For why should others' false adulterate (c)eyes(/c)
Or on my frailties why are frailer (c)spies(/c)
Which in their wills count bad what I think (d)good(/d)
No I am that I am and they that (e)level(/e)
At my abuses reckon up their (f)own(/f)
I may be straight though they themselves be (e)bevel(/e)
By their rank thoughts my deeds must not be (f)shown(/f)
All men are bad and in their badness (g)reign(/g)
